name: Cubic polynomials are point symmetric
description:
Please give a proof that every cubic polynomial is symmetric to a point, i.e. if `$f\colon \mathbb{R}\rightarrow\mathbb{R}$` is a cubic polynomial `$f(x) = ax^3+bx^2+cx+d$` with real coefficients and `$a\neq0$` then there exists a point `$(x,y)$` such that for all `$h\in\mathbb{R}$`
```math
f(x+h) - y = -\bigl(f(x-h)-y\bigr).
```
